ygData.subject: SUSE Studio RESTful API. Is it RESTful?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey there, I am totally new to REST, and I am looking at this API from the SUSE Studio project (which is awesome and I recommend checking it out).

Subject: SUSE Studio RESTful API. Is it RESTful?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=410124108; y=SbHGf38QZdziAapk_N75dr8Jraml84x_4ewWI3IHtXeTRW96V0_sn24
X-Yahoo-Profile: thedesignofsoftware
X-YGroups-SubInfo: t=0;f=16;g=V8yoYq4eUjKM-BFZuEys2JqjiQLMbrjDhSp_6hnVFilpSJYsvrgeMuHiUo_nLdhxnKs;
X-eGroups-Approved-By: gonga_thrash <distobj@...> via web; 17 Aug 2009 18:06:45 -0000

Hey there,

I am totally new to REST, and I am looking at this API from the=
 SUSE Studio project (which is awesome and I recommend checking it out). 

=
http://susestudio.com/help/api/v1

I fully understand the API and how it wo=
rks, but I'm just wondering how well(philosophically) some of the API metho=
ds fit into the REST principles. For instance:

POST /api/v1/user/appliance=
s/<id>/cmd/remove_package?name=3D<name>

Is used to *remove* a package from=
 a virtual appliance.

Wouldn't a more restful approach be something like

=
DELETE /user/appliances/<id>/packages/<name>

Any comments that will help m=
y understanding of REST principles are greatly appreciated. Also, if you ca=
n help me to understand why they would have chosen one way over the other. =
The site is built on Ruby on Rails (according to their twitter stream).
